intro: Medicago italica var. obscura, commonly known as the dark medick, is a perennial legume native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has a creeping growth habit and produces small, rounded pods containing several seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and is used in ecological restoration due to its ability to fix nitrogen. Its botanical features make it an important species in both agricultural and natural habitats.
